creator: Simon Sinek
description: A framework for understanding why organizations exist and how they inspire action
core_concept: People don't buy what you do, they buy why you do it

why.definition: The purpose, cause, or belief that drives the organization
questions: What is your cause or belief?
What is your purpose beyond making money?
examples: Apple: 'Think Different' - challenging the status quo
Tesla: 'Accelerate the world's transition to sustainable transport'
Patagonia: 'We're in business to save our home planet'

scoring_dimensions.name: Clarity
scoring_dimensions.definition: How clear and well-articulated is the WHY?

scoring_dimensions.name: Authenticity
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does it reflect true beliefs and values?

scoring_dimensions.name: Inspiration
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does it inspire and motivate people?

scoring_dimensions.name: Consistency
scoring_dimensions.definition: Is it consistent across all communications?

scoring_dimensions.name: Differentiation
scoring_dimensions.definition: Is it unique and meaningful?

scoring_dimensions.name: Emotional Resonance
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does it connect emotionally?

how.definition: The specific actions taken to realize the why
questions: How do you fulfill your why?
How do you deliver on your promise?
examples: Apple: Beautiful, intuitive design and user experience
Tesla: Direct-to-consumer sales and over-the-air updates
Patagonia: Sustainable materials and environmental activism

scoring_dimensions.name: Uniqueness
scoring_dimensions.definition: What makes your HOW distinctive?

scoring_dimensions.name: Clarity
scoring_dimensions.definition: How clearly defined are your methods?

scoring_dimensions.name: Consistency
scoring_dimensions.definition: Do you consistently follow your HOW?

scoring_dimensions.name: Alignment
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does your HOW support your WHY?

scoring_dimensions.name: Proof Points
scoring_dimensions.definition: Can you demonstrate your HOW with evidence?

scoring_dimensions.name: Competitive Moat
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does your HOW create barriers to competition?

questions: What products or services do you offer?
What do customers buy from you?
characteristics: The result of why and how
examples: Tesla: Electric vehicles, energy products, software

scoring_dimensions.name: Clarity
scoring_dimensions.definition: How clear are your offerings?

scoring_dimensions.name: Alignment
scoring_dimensions.definition: Do your products/services align with WHY and HOW?

scoring_dimensions.name: Quality
scoring_dimensions.definition: Is the quality consistent and excellent?

scoring_dimensions.name: Proof
scoring_dimensions.definition: Do your offerings prove your WHY and HOW?

scoring_dimensions.name: Evolution
scoring_dimensions.definition: Do you innovate while staying true to WHY?

scoring_dimensions.name: Market Fit
scoring_dimensions.definition: Do your offerings meet market needs?

who.definition: The target audience who believes what you believe
examples: Apple: Creative professionals, early adopters, design enthusiasts
Tesla: Environmentally conscious, tech-savvy, luxury buyers
Patagonia: Outdoor enthusiasts, environmental activists, quality seekers

scoring_dimensions.name: Clarity
scoring_dimensions.definition: How clearly defined is your audience?

scoring_dimensions.name: Alignment
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does your audience share your WHY?

scoring_dimensions.name: Specificity
scoring_dimensions.definition: Are you specific or too broad?

scoring_dimensions.name: Understanding
scoring_dimensions.definition: Do you deeply understand their needs?

scoring_dimensions.name: Resonance
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does your message resonate with them?

scoring_dimensions.name: Loyalty
scoring_dimensions.definition: Does your WHO create loyal advocates?

why_opportunities: Strengthen purpose messaging for higher prices
